item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like pi√±a coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Attendee of GDG Prime 2015
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.content:encoded:
We just want to thank you for your attendance in GDG Prime 2015 Bandung. The event itself was great, attended by more than 1450 participants, 290 exhibitors and 150 delegation from more than 13 Country and tens of global brand.
It has been our honour to personally see almost all of the games exhibited, its our personal belief that the event is bringing hope to Indonesia game industry to compete in the unforgiving global and national market.
The event itself can only be materialized by the support from the sponsors and organizers. So we want to give credits to Ministry of ICT, Asosiasi Ministry of Industrial Affair, Agency of Creative Economy, University of Telkom, Dicoding,¬†Microsoft,¬†POKKT,¬†Valuepotion,¬†Goethe,¬†Touchten,¬†Adways,¬†Unity,¬†YummyYummyTummy,¬†Universita Atmajaya Jogjakarta,¬†Universitas Ciputra,¬†Bandung Digital Valley,¬†Long Data,¬†Gemu Gemu,¬†Tinker Games,¬†Agate,¬†Game Dev ID,¬†Toge Production,¬†Mojiken and¬†Agate Jogja.
We also want to say thank you for the support of all media partners Techinasia,¬†Jalantikus,¬†TeknoJournal,¬†HarianTI,¬†Aitinesa,¬†Liputan 6,¬†MetroTV,¬†Kotakgame, Inigame, GameQQ and may more that attend.
Eventhough there are many imperfections in the event such as missing schedule, some program such as game dev clinic and free forum canceled, change of layout and facilities, blazing hot room, ridiculus atmospehere and "all dark" VIP Dinner, it is safe to assume that we have some fun on GDG Prime 2015.
On GDG 2016, we believe that we can bigger, better and more fruitful event. So we will keep you updated on GDG Prime 2016 news
Last but not least, thank you guys, You Seriously Rocks !!
 
Sincerely,
Organizer Team

item.title: Untuk Hindari Sambaran Petir, Sebaiknya Tak Berlindung di Bawah Tangga Halte
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.content:encoded: Jakarta - Hujan November ini diwarnai dengan kilatan petir dan angin kencang. Masyarakat tentu perlu berhati-hati, meski begitu hujan petir dan angin hanya akan marak di awal musim penghujan ini. "Biasanya, frekuensi hujan disertai petir dan angin kencang hanya terjadi di awal-awal musim penghujan," kata Kepala Sub Bidang Informasi Badan Metereologi Klimatologi dan Geofisika (BMKG) Hary Tirto Djatmiko kepada detikcom, Senin (9/11/2015). Gemuruh guntur masih akan terdengar dalam waktu dekat ini. Untuk menghindari bahaya petir, diharapkan masyarakat bisa berhati-hati bila sedang berada di luar ruangan. "Kita harus mencari posisi bangunan yang lebih tinggi untuk berlindung, atau bangunan yang punya proteksi petir tentu lebih aman," kata Hary. Bila ingin perlindungan selagi dalam perjalanan, masyarakat bisa berlindung di bangunan permanen, atau lebih aman lagi masuk saja ke dalam gedung. Berlindung di bawah pohon tidak disarankan. "Berlindung di bawah tangga Halte Busway perlu kewaspadaan. Alangkah baiknya berlindung di bangunan yang permanen," kata dia. Sama halnya dengan menyikapi angin kencang, masyarakat juga perlu hati-hati dan mencari perlindungan di bangunan yang kokoh. Angin kencang bermacam-macam jenisnya, mulai dari angin ribut hingga puting beliung. "Angin kencang bukan berarti angin puting beliung. Kalau angin puting beliung itu bentuknya seperti corong. Angin ribut seperti ini marak terjadi di musim pancaroba seperti sekarang. Intensitasnya akan menurun memasuki pertengahan musim," kata dia. Sebagaimana diberitakan sebelumnya, sejumlah peristiwa orang tersambar petir sudah terjadi. Viki Adiansyah (10) tewas di pekarangan belakang rumahnya, di Ponorogo Jawa Timur. Di Jonggol Bogor Jawa Barat, seorang pria bernama Nahilan (68) tewas tersambar petir di persawahan. Keduanya tewas pada Sabtu (7/11/2015). Angin puting beliung juga menerjang Blora Jawa Tengah, sore sebelum hujan Minggu (8/11) kemarin. 15 Rumah rusak tertimpa pohon tumbang. Di Jakarta, sebuah pohon di kolong Jembatan Semanggi tumbang karena angin kencang. ===== Ini Sebab Petir dan Angin Ribut Sering Terjadi di Awal Musim Hujan Petir dan angin kencang acapkali mengiringi hujan di awal musim penghujan ini. Apa hubungannya awal musim penghujan dengan petir dan angin kencang yang sering terjadi? Kepala Sub Bidang Informasi Badan Metereologi Klimatologi dan Geofisika (BMKG) Hary Tirto Djatmiko menjelaskan kepada detikcom, Senin (9/11/2015). Petir dan angin ribut terjadi di awal musim penghujan karena ada banyak energi yang tersimpan saat pergantian suhu, begitulah kira-kira pemahaman umumnya. "Di awal musim, banyak energi di awan-awan yang terbentuk," kata Hary mengawali penjelasan. Namun, energi itu mengalami perubahan dari panas ke dingin. Perubahan dari suhu panas ke dingin ini sering terjadi saat musim pancaroba dari musim kemarau ke musim penghujan seperti sekarang. "Awan konvektif terbentuk dari pagi hingga siang. Kemudian siang sampai malam hujan lebat. Dari panas ke hujan akan banyak energi yang tersimpan, terjadilah petir," tutur Hary. Lalu kenapa petir mulai berkurang saat pertengahan musim penghujan? Itu karena di pertengahan musim, cuaca sudah relatif stabil. "Di tengah musim, hujan turun tak mengenal waktu," kata dia. Penjelasan soal angin kencang juga paralel dengan penjelasan soal petir. Pada saat seperti sekarang ini, penguapan dan radiasi cukup tinggi. Begitu awan hujan terbentuk maka energi yang tersimpan juga cukup tinggi. Bilamana kilat dan angin ribut akan terjadi? Bila siang panas dan sore mendung, begitulah penjelasan sederhananya. "Masyarakat merasa gerah dan pengap saat pagi hingga siang. Di langit, awan seperti bunga kol bertumbuh, kemudian warnanya menjadi kehitaman. Potensi itulah yang membuat hujan lebat disertai kilat, petir, dan angin kencang dalam durasi singkat," paparnya. Sebagaimana diberitakan sebelumnya, sejumlah peristiwa orang tersambar petir sudah terjadi. Viki Adiansyah (10) tewas di pekarangan belakang rumahnya, di Ponorogo Jawa Timur. Di Jonggol Bogor Jawa Barat, seorang pria bernama Nahilan (68) tewas tersambar petir di persawahan. Keduanya tewas pada Sabtu (7/11/2015). Angin puting beliung juga menerjang Blora Jawa Tengah, sore sebelum hujan Minggu (8/11) kemarin. 15 Rumah rusak tertimpa pohon tumbang. Di Jakarta, sebuah pohon di kolong Jembatan Semanggi tumbang karena angin kencang.

item.title: My little sister got on the wrong bus and now she's been missing for two weeks. Please help.
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.content:encoded: So I need your help. My little sister Laura went missing two weeks ago, and the police are not being helpful. She was supposed to take a bus from Albuquerque, NM, north up I-25 to Denver, CO, to visit her boyfriend but she never made it and as far as I can tell, she got on the wrong bus. She said she reserved the ticket through Greyhound online, but Greyhound doesn't have any records of her buying anything, and they say they don't have buses like the one she got on. I was hoping maybe some of you could help narrow down her location from hints in our last text exchange. I've copied the texts below (I fixed some stuff for grammar and spelling; she had only an old flip phone so she was number-pad typing everything, so I did stuff like capital letters and stuff. I didn't change the content at all). I know how Reddit has that amazing ability to track people down, and I was thinking maybe you guys might see something the police missed (or were too lazy to follow up on, knowing them). There's some kind of dispute about jurisdiction in this case (Albuquerque police say it's a State Police matter, State Police say it's up to the police department for the county where she went missing, but we don't even know where that is, so no one wants to handle it). Please, this is my little sister, and I know she's in trouble so if you can figure something out, please help. Here is our text message exchange from beginning to end: (Monday, Nov. 2, 2015, 8:04 AM) Laura: Yo, I made it to the station okay. You would not believe the fucking bus I have to ride. John: Why? Is it sweet? Laura: Opposite. I'm not joking, it's a repainted schoolbus. Painted white with, like, rust colored? Maybe that's just rust lol. John: A schoolbus? Are you joking? Didn't you say you were riding Greyhound? Laura: Yeah. Dude, its edges are all rounded like the 50s, you know? A bit puffy like it's been hitting the ice cream a little too hard lately, lol. Is this bus gonna make it to CO? John: You should complain and try to get on a better bus. Laura: Omg, they just turned on the engine and it has this horrible screeching noise, like a cat screaming. Am I gonna have to listen to this for seven hours? Laura: No wonder it was so cheap, lol. (8:16 AM) Laura: Dude, this bus came from Mexico. Everybody on here only speaks Spanish. I asked the lady in the station if this was the right bus and she insists it is. Damn, this is gonna be a loooong seven hours. John: Good luck. Laura: I'm gonna need it. (8:31 AM) Laura: Takeoff. The bus driver is only announcing stuff in Spanish, man. You think they'd have something in English... (8:39 AM) Laura: Uh, for some reason we're going west on I-40 lol? This is making me kinda nervous... (8:43 AM) Laura: Dude, we're still on I-40. I think I got on the wrong bus. Shit... (8:45 AM) Laura: John, are you there? I'm pretty sure I'm on the wrong bus. What should I do? (8:48 AM) Laura: I tried to talk to the bus driver. No English of course (><) but wtf am I supposed to do? I was like "Denver? Denver?" and he was like "No, no," but I could catch what else he said. No one else on the bus was helping either. There's like no conversations at all. Everyone's just staring out the window. Bystander effect, I guess. Maybe I should ask around directly for someone who speaks English. Laura: How do you say "Where is this bus going" in Spanish? (8:57 AM) John: Sorry, I was in the shower. Bad timing. Did you get it figured out? Laura: No, we're still headed west on 40. We're out of the city by now, nothing but desert on all sides. John: Damn, you definitely got on the wrong bus then. I looked it up in Google translate: "Hacia donde va este autobus?" in Spanish maybe? Laura: Ok, I'll try. (9:13 AM) Laura: I don't know what he said but it def wasn't Denver. Fuck me. John: Maybe you should ask all the passengers if they speak English. Laura: Oh, wait, we're turning off I-40 now. Laura: We just got on another highway. Tiny two lane one. We're going south now. Where the hell are we going? Are there even any cities down this way? John: It seems too far but maybe you're headed toward Quemado or Acoma? Laura: I dunno, there are no signs. John: What about mile markers? Laura: Not any I see. John: The only other place I see down there is Magdalena but you'd think they'd take I-25 instead if you're headed there. Laura: This is weird. John: Hang on, I'm gonna call Greyhoud. (9:34 AM) John: Sorry that took so long. They say there was no bus like that. You mean it was literally a schoolbus, right? Laura: Yeah, the old kind of school bus with the curved edges, but it's repainted white. John: Greyhound says they don't have any buses like that. Laura: What should I do? John: I'll call back, see if they know other companies that might have a bus like that. Laura: Thanks John: Maybe you should get off the next stop, then I'll take off work and come get you. Laura: I don't know where I am though. I should probably just go to the final destination then hop a bus back from there. John: What if it's going to Mexico? Did you bring your passport? Laura: Damn, didn't think of that. John: Let me call Grehound back. (10:07 AM) John: They said they didn't know anything about anything. Great help. You don't happen to have any receipts or confirmation numbers or anything? Laura: No, I didn't print it out. Maybe it's in the email. Can you check my inbox? My password is *********. John: I'm checking. I'm not seeing anything. What was the title? Laura: Probably something like "Trip Confirmation." John: When did you buy it? Laura: Friday. John: There's nothing here. John: How did you get on the bus without a printed ticket? Laura: I dunno. I checked the email before I came this morning and it said the bus number, then I just got on. No one asked to see anything. John: They just let you on the bus without a ticket or making sure you had a reservation? Laura: Yeah. John: Laura, there's no email in your inbox from any bus company. Laura: You're fucking kidding me, right? This is a prank, right? If this is a prank, I will never forgive you ever. John: If this is a prank, it's totally not from me. Laura: I'm about to start crying here. Please tell me if this is a prank. John: I swear it's not a prank. Laura: Okay, let me try to talk to the other passengers. (10:44 AM) Laura: They don't answer. Not even in Spanish. They just look at me and then look out the window. Some don't even look. This is creepy as hell. This has got to be a prank. John: None of them will speak to you? Laura: I'm crying right now. Please tell me if this is a joke. John: Laura, I don't know what to say. It's not a joke, not from me at least. (11:13 AM) Laura: Oh, we're stopping. It's like one of those Indian trading posts you see, all run down though. There's a gas station and a little shop. John: Go in and ask where you are. Laura: Duh. (11:24 AM) Laura: There are no people in the shop. The bus driver's filling the bus with gas with a credit card. Some of the other passengers got off and wandered around but then just got back on. No one said anything. John: Maybe you should call the police. Laura: Is this a police matter? John: Do you feel like you need outside help? Laura: Yes, definitely yes. John: Then call them. Tell them you got on a bus and no one speaks English and you're really lost. Maybe they can at least tell you where you're calling from, then I can come pick you up. Laura: Okay, I'll try that. The bus is leaving again, though, so I'm gonna get on. Better than being stuck here. John: Maybe you should just stay there. If there's stuff at the shop, someone must come around eventually. There's bottled water and stuff, right? Maybe they're just on break or something, small town people who don't bother to lock the shop when they go. (11:37 AM) Laura: I called the police and told them what was going on, and they didn't believe me. It was this bitchy lady and she told me to stop wasting her time and that I was blocking real emergencies. Fuck. John: Next time stay off the bus and then call again and say you're stranded? Then it will be a real emergency. Laura: Somehow being stranded out here seems worse than being on this bus. (12:17 PM) John: Laura, you still doing okay? (12:51 PM) Laura: Sorry, I didn't get your message till just now. Service is getting spotty. We're still on a tiny highway, but a different one. We turned a bit west about twenty minutes ago. John: Have you seen any road signs? Laura: Not the green ones you usually see. I saw some wooden ones but the paint was all sunbleached. I'm guessing it was for rundown trading posts or whatever. John: No mile makers? Laura: No, none that I've seen and I've been looking. John: Are you still in NM? Laura: Your guess is as good mine, though we might have crossed into AZ if the road was heading SW. Laura: Oh, there was a sign. It was in Spanish I think. John: What did it say? Laura: Sombra de las Animas I think John: Let me Google translate that. John: Oh, "Shadow of the souls." That's cheery. Laura: Is it a town? John: There's an area called "Animas" down near the left tip of NM. Nothing about shadows or anything though. Laura: There's like nothing around though. Just mountains and desert. We haven't seen civilization in hours. John: Creepy, but that's NM. No need to panic just yet. (1:42 PM) Laura: We're stopping again. It looks like a bus stop by the side of the highway. There's about five people standing there. Laura: Yeah, they're getting on. Laura: Not talking, not looking, just sitting down in the empty seats. Laura: We're going again. John: Do they look like normal people? Laura: Yeah. I mean, what do normal people look like? But if I passed them on the street I wouldn't think anything. Laura: They're all hispanic looking though. I think I'm the only white person here. John: Lol, racist. Laura: Just stating facts here, lol. (2:01 PM) Laura: Wait, one of them got up. He's talking to the bus driver. Laura: Doesn't seem to be getting any farther than I did. Laura: Now he's trying to talk to the other people. Maybe he's a normal person? I'm gonna try to talk to him. John: Be careful. (2:15 PM) Laura: Yeah, he's normal, but he doesn't speak much English so communicating was hard. His name is Raul and he's from Mexico or Houston, not sure which. He isn't headed for Denver though. John: Did he say what the driver said? Laura: He said the driver didn't speak Spanish. John: Then what the hell was he speaking? Laura: No idea. Maybe like Navajo or something? That's all we can figure. What other languages are spoken around here? Laura: I don't really know what Navajo sounds like. What little the bus driver said sounded like Spanish to me but I guess not. John: What kind of American bus driver doesn't speak English OR Spanish??? (2:34 PM) Laura: We're stopping again. This town seems more inhabited. It's all covered in Day of the Dead decorations though. John: Well that makes sense. It is Day of the Dead today. Creepy though. Laura:Yeah. There are a lot of people around. The women are all wearing brightly colored dresses. Long skirts with lace and stuff. Very pretty. Must be a Day of the Dead festival. They're all wearing masks or face paint. John: Like skulls? You don't sound appropriately freaked out here. Laura: God, there must be over a thousand people crowded in on this one little road here. But all the buildings are like old ass adobe. Laura: Wow, this is a beautiful town though. There are like rows and rows of adobe houses. Kind old style, the angles aren't quite right, you know, probably built by hand, similar to those ruins you see in Aztec or Mesa Verde but you know, not ruined lol. And since it's getting dark out, they're starting to light a bunch of luminarias. John: What do you mean it's getting dark out? It's not even 3PM yet. Laura: What are you talking about? We've been driving for hours. John: What time does your phone say? Laura: About 7PM. John: wtf Laura: Okay, I'm getting a bad feeling about this. Their faces look really creepy like skulls in the dusk. They're all looking at the bus just standing there now. Laura: God, there are some people standing on the roofs, men dressed in black suits and hats staring down their faces painted like skulls. Why is this so creepy but fuck it is. John: Laura, you need to get the fuck out of there. Laura: Everyone's getting off the bus. Raul is too. He looks scared outta his mind tho. When he got up I was like "are you serious?" but he just shrugged and kept going. I'm gonna wait and see if he comes back. John: Yeah, don't fucking go in that town ffs. (3:09 PM) John: Laura, everything okay? Laura: Yeah, he's not back yet. John: What about the people in the town. Laura: Still standing there. Every once in awhile they walk around but they're not actually doing anything. Raul and the others walked into the crowd and they just kinda blended in, now I can't pick them out. I'm crouched down on the seat peeking out the window. I don't think the skulls have seen me yet. John: Laura, call the police again. Laura: I tried. They answered in Spanish, or not English at least, and then hung up on me. John: Fuck, I'll call the police here. Stay on that bus! (3:26 PM) John: Laura, the police are trying to track you but I'm not sure they took me seriously. Laura: Maybe I should go in the town. Maybe it's just a festival or something. John: Don't! Fucking drive the bus back yourself or something! Laura: I thought of that, lol. The driver took the keys. John: Let me look up how to hotwire buses. Laura: I'm just gonna go see what they say. Or I'll find a phone. I'll call you with a landline, then it'll be easier to track, right? John: Seriously, don't! Stay where you are. Just wait for help. Laura: Oh fuck. John: What? Laura: I stood up and they all just turned to look at me. Laura: God they're just staring at me. John: Laura, see if you can find an extra set of keys for the bus. I'm seriously looking up how to hotwire it now. Laura: Hurry. Laura: When I tried to move to the front they came closer to the bus. They're surrounding Laura: oh god John please help Laura: Jesus their faces John: Laura, just hang on a bit! (3:29 PM) John: Are you still on the bus? (3:31 PM) John: Laura, are you still on the bus? John: I can't find about buses specifically but I found directions for hotwiring a car. You can try. (3:34 PM) John: Laura, answer me, just a progress report or something, I'm seriously worried here. (4:02 PM) John: I'm calling the police again. (8:13 PM) John: Laura, please call me. I set a bunch more similar messages after this one, but this is the last one that went through. All the ones afterward were undeliverable because her service was out. She of course never responded. If you guys know of this town or if any details stood out to you, please let me know on this site. Please don't contact the police directly because like I said, they're arguing over jurisdiction and your tips might get lost in the mess. Please let me know so I can make sure they actually get the message. This is my little sister and she's the most important person to me, so please, if you know anything or even just have an idea or anything, please let me know. EDIT 11/15/15 12:14PM: Hey, a lot of people have asked about her phone service. She has T-mobile. I forgot to mention that we already contacted them and they tracked her phone a ways outside Albuquerque along I-40, but then she entered a dead-zone in their service and afterwards her phone never re-registered on their network. This happened long before I lost contact with her, so I don't know how I was talking to her or what phone network her phone was using if not T-mobile... Also, a lot of people think she might have entered Mexico. My mom and I are going to stop by the state police department in Albuquerque and we'll try to get them to contact the police in Mexico too. Thank you for all your help so far. The comments are rolling in and they're all very helpful! I'm having trouble keeping up with them, but I'm definitely reading them all so keep them coming! EDIT 11/15/15 2:54 PM Hey guys, so my Mom and I went to the state police department and we finally got a cop who seemed to listen. We showed her the texts again and tried to play it up like my sister was just freaking out because she was lost, not because she was seeing ghosts or anything like that, to get the cop to take us seriously. Anyway, the cop agreed that there was a good chance that my sister ended up in Arizona or Mexico, and now that it's crossed state lines she said she'd contact the FBI and the FBI would contact the Mexican police if they needed to. So that's good. We'll see if anything comes out of this. My dad and I are planning to retrace my sister's steps tomorrow, see if we can find anything she mentioned along the bus ride. I'll update later about that. Also, her boyfriend is in Colorado. I asked him if he got any texts before, but he's being kind of a jerk because the police investigated to make sure he wasn't a suspect and now he's all pissed because he thinks WE told them that he kidnapped her or something. I've never much liked the guy but I don't think he's behind this and neither do the cops. He said he only got a few texts and they're about the same as the ones I got--a couple about the old ass bus and another one saying she wouldn't make it to Denver because she got on the wrong bus. That's about it. Anyway, I'll let you all know if something comes up. Thanks for your help! A lot of you have given me hope that she's still alive!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: So far I'm pretty sure I know what gas station they stopped at which is called El Mitote Gas and Diesel in Old Horse Springs. It looks like what your sister said and according to 1 review you can only pay by credit card as there is no one around, also I calculated the time your sister mentioned getting on the highway to the gas station which was 2 hours and 34 minutes, and to get too this gas station from the Grey Hound bus port is 2 hours and 33 mins. Only issue is that your sister mentioned going on I-40W but Google Maps said the best route was to take 25, I'll continue further but I wanted to see if this sounds right to anyone else. Update: I continued down the roads and tried to use the times with the phone with Google maps times, when she said she made a west I calculated Mule Creek Rd. being in the ball bark, it's difficult because she mentioned the turn was maybe 20 minutes ago. But then she mentioned picking up people off the highway, which from the turn at Mule Creek in AZ to this place called Three Way in AZ was around the same times according to when she turned and picked up people. I checked with Three Way from the start Grey Hound Bus Station and it was 5 hours and 4 mins according to Google maps , according to the phone times she's been on the road for 5 hours and 3mins. So I'm thinking I'm still on the right track. Update 2: From Three Way, AZ to the next town where she finally stopped is hard to determine since there are a few towns from that point but the one that made it closest to cells phones times with Google maps times was Eden, AZ next was Lordsburg, NM. Now it could be closer or a little further because there is a lot of variations such as filling up gas times and the times she sent the info. I did notice there is a ranger station at Three Way, AZ location: 397240 AZ-75, Duncan, AZ 85534 so maybe they could help with recent day of the dead festivals if my calculations are close. I hope this helps :)

I've tried basing my search on information given about the gas station, too. The most I can say is if Laura really was traveling West on I-40, the the more likely highway that the bus turned south on was between mile markers 108 and 126. And from what I can tell, all of those crossing streets have two Lane roads.

Yeah I started going by what she said, and then I just typed in gas station and searched the ones that followed her description in the area by using road view and Old Horse Springs was the closest I could gather within the same time she left the station till she reached the gas station plus that one review from that person really helped make it more possible.

Yeah I started going by what she said, and then I just typed in gas station and searched the ones that followed her description in the area by using road view and Old Horse Springs was the closest I could gather within the same time she left the station till she reached the gas station plus that one review from that person really helped make it more possible.
